issue.body:
Add debug logging to help diagnose #30469. Nothing too interesting there
on a successful run, but perhaps when it fails?

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

body: Cloud be related to GHActions VS Jenkins  as I've seen it again in https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/30449/checks?check_run_id=3252611503#step:6:19223

> Cloud be related to GHActions VS Jenkins

Yes, this problem indeed shows up on GHA while it went unnoticed on Jenkins

When reading this stacktrace, be really careful about the line number: I previously thought the failure was on the line `suffixF.value should be(empty)`, which would be hard to explain, but looking closer I now think the failure was on the line `notUsedF.value should be(empty)` - which is an invalid assumption: `notUsedF.value` is resolved immediately when the substream is materialized, not when the substream completes, so it is entirely possible that it is non-empty already before expecting the subscription.

issue.title: Fix FlowFlatMapPrefixSpec instability

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
`notUsedF` is resolved immediately when the substream is materialized,
unlike `suffixF` which is resolved when the stream completes. For this
reason it is entirely possible that `notUsedF` resolves before getting the
subscriptions.

Fixes #30469
